project.teaser: The large scale integration of renewable energy sources (RES) has introduced a new operating paradigm. Renewable energy sources are characterized by uncertainty and volatility. Moreover, overloading of transmission and distribution feeders have become more frequent. The...
project.objective: The large scale integration of renewable energy sources (RES) has introduced a new operating paradigm. Renewable energy sources are characterized by uncertainty and volatility. Moreover, overloading of transmission and distribution feeders have become more frequent. The curtailment of renewable power generation has thus increased, contradicting the goals for high shares of RES. A valuable solution to these challenges is the introduction of flexibility from flexible resources and loads. In this context, FlexCHESS project proposes cutting-edge solutions based on digital twin concept, Virtual energy storage systems (VESS) and Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) to revolutionize the existing practices. Based on the aggregation of Connected Hybrid Energy Storage System (CHESS), FlexCHESS improves the grid stability while increasing the profitability of its installations by guaranteeing various ancillary services at the distribution and transmission network levels. FlexCHESS will also ensure the highest level of interoperability of the proposed solutions and enhance the innovation capacity and competitiveness of SMEs and Startups in Europe by unlocking access to meaningful information and co-creating new business opportunities. This will be achieved by the appropriate promoting of open innovation and making smart technologies an asset for intelligent business. In order to validate and evaluate the proposed solutions, five pilot sites demonstrations with diverse assets in different European countries are planned. The aggregation and optimization of different resources will be extended to take into account not only electrical energy storage systems (ESS), but also multi-ESSs. Thus, FlexCHESS project will define different scenarios allowing to evaluate the performances and flexibility capability of CHESS. FlexCHESS project Consortium gathers 3 universities, 2 large companies, 3DSOs, 4 SMEs, and 2 NGO.

result.title: A report on the optimal adaptation of DERs within FlexCHESS and the key requirements of efficient deployment of FlexCHESS nodes
result.description: A report on the optimal adaptation of DERs within FlexCHESS and the key requirements of efficient deployment of FlexCHESS nodes.

result.title: Report on the technical requirements
result.description: Report on the technical specifications by identifying functionalities and describing the components and system architecture of the FlexCHESS solutions

result.title: Kick-off report and detailed roadmap

result.description: Data Management Plan including data governance, General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the instructions to erasure data, and database management.

result.title: Report on FlexCHESS concept
result.description: In this report FlexCHESS concepts will be defined and the flexibility quantification and exploitation will be analyzed through some indicators

result.title: Definition of FlexCHESS’ use cases and scenarios
result.description: To demonstrate the capabilities and values of FlexCHESS, a number of representative use cases and linked scenarios will be reported.

result.title: Report on systems interoperability & communication layer architecture specifications
result.description: Report on interoperability communication layer of the FlexCHESS solution, system architecture specifications, and development.

result.title: A report on needs and flexibility requirements
result.description: This report will identify key initiatives at the National European and international levels and evaluate the expectations barriers enablers needs and trends in flexibility services

result.title: Report on flexibility services
result.description: D14 will study the specifications of various flexibility services to different parties including the definition Quantification Exploitation and Provision of Services

result.description: Report on the dissemination, and Communications activities carried out during the project.

result.title: Demand Response from Steelmaking Process Coordinated with Energy Storage Systems

result.description: Report on the validation of FlexCHESS solution including a user manual of the Open flexibility platform.

result.description: Report on joint actions activities, and results of collaborations with similar projects.

result.description: Report on the quality assurance plan, risk assessment, indicators to monitor the project progress, and the applied corrective actions.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication plan
result.description: Report on dissemination and communication plan It includes a detailed roadmap of events and actions to be carried out by FlexCHESS

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
